dcterms:description: The copy task tests whether NTM can store and recall a long sequence of arbitrary information. The network is presented with an input sequence of random binary vectors followed by a delimiter flag.
dcterms:title: Copy Task

dcterms:description: The repeat copy task extends copy by requiring the network to output the copied sequence a specified number of times and then emit an end-of-sequence marker.
dcterms:title: Repeat Copy Task

dcterms:description: The associative recall task involves querying with one of the items and asking the network to produce the subsequent item from a list of items.
dcterms:title: Associative Recall Task

dcterms:description: The dynamic N-Grams task tests whether NTM can rapidly adapt to new predictive distributions by using its memory as a re-writable table to keep count of transition statistics.
dcterms:title: Dynamic N-Grams Task

dcterms:description: The priority sort task tests whether the NTM can sort data based on priority ratings assigned to each vector.
dcterms:title: Priority Sort Task
